pr_title: Extract interface from `MoreIndices`/`ElasticsearchProbe` classes to encapsulate ES-specifics

timeline.bodyText:
I think it make sense to move this method into ClusterAdapter (or create a separate interface which ClusterAdapterES6 implements?) and get rid of ElasticsearchProbe completely. Right now ElasticsearchProbe#elasticsearchStats calls 4 different methods from ClusterAdapter, 3 of which are only used here. Those could become private, if the method were moved, thus reducing coupling.
The moved method should get the indices as a parameter to avoid a dependency on IndexSetRegistry, i.e. something like this: ClusterAdapter#statsForIndices(List<String> indices).
It would imply that org.graylog2.system.stats.ClusterStatsService would need the dependency on IndexSetRegistry, but that seems acceptable to me.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText:
Wouldn't it make sense to rename this to EventIndices while we're at it? I find MoreIndices too vague for it's very specific purpose. EventWriter or EventIndexer would be even more specific. Same would go for MoreIndicesAdapter and MoreIndicesAdapterES6.
The method name bulkIndex on the other hand is unnecessarily specific. write would be a fine alternative imo.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: I would love it, if you could unpack this by extracting lambda blocks to private methods. Ideally we'd only have one line lambdas, which are much easier to read than these nested blocks.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.message:
Consolidating ES stats fetching, cleaning up `CluterAdapter` interface.
